data.title: Lessons from the Animal Kingdom on How to Survive the Office
data.meta_description: Tired of being invisible, overlooked at team meetings, asked to do office housework and work overtime? See a funny comic on how to channel your inner animal to survive working at the office.
data.text:
Tired of being invisible and overlooked at team meetings? Shock and awe with a deimatic display that would make a frilled-neck lizard proud. Stare unblinkingly until your co-workers finally listen to you.

Embrace your inner vulture to become the ultimate scavenger of catered meeting leftovers. Train your senses to smell cold cuts from twenty workstations away. Then, slowly circle your co-workers at the lunch table, waiting for an opportunity to swoop in and grab their half-eaten tuna fish sandwich.

Are you unfairly assigned office housework that’s outside the scope of your job? When you hear the boss squawking for someone to order a team lunch or plan a party, disappear into your surroundings.

Claim your cubicle by sprinkling it with the dusty remnants of Flamin’ Hot Cheetos. The pungent, moldy odor of your favorite snack will deter trespassers. If Fred from accounting tries to steal your TI-84 graphing calculator again, he will be caught red-handed.

Are your coworkers overstaying their welcome in the conference room that you reserved? With the grace of a gazelle, leap in the air repeatedly to intimidate colleagues so they’ll scatter. No one will dare challenge your Big Kick Energy.

Be warned, a new teammate may swagger in and steal your thunder. Prove you’re the alpha chimp by air squatting for hours on end; you don’t need a chair to do that spreadsheet! Your booming keystrokes will command respect.

If your manager grabs you to work overtime on a Friday, create a diversion. Just as a gecko sheds its tail to distract predators, release whatever you have at hand — a quarterly report, your coffee mug, a prized lanyard — into the air and quickly scurry away.

When HR approaches to discuss your animalistic behavior, flop to the ground and play possum. Hope that they empathize and grant you medical leave.
